notes: Currie and Walker (2011) 'Traffic Congestion and Infant Health: Evidence from E-ZPass'. DiD comparing birth outcomes near vs far from toll plazas, before vs after E-ZPass adoption. Birth certificate data from NJ and PA. First stage shows E-ZPass reduced local air pollution (NO2, SO2). Data is compressed .dta.gz files.

design_audit.notes: Classic 2x2 DiD: near (within 2km of toll plaza) x post (after E-ZPass adoption) interaction. Multiple specifications with different near_distance thresholds (1.5km, 2km), control distances (5km, 10km), and FE structures. Mother FE used in preferred specification. Clustering at date level.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Infant health outcomes (birth weight, prematurity, low birth weight, gestation)
claim_object.treatment_concept: E-ZPass adoption reducing traffic congestion near toll plazas
claim_object.estimand_concept: ATT of E-ZPass-induced pollution reduction on birth outcomes for mothers near toll plazas
claim_object.target_population: Births to mothers living near toll plazas in NJ and PA

baseline_specs.label: Table3-BirthWeight-MomFE
baseline_specs.notes: Baseline DiD with mother FE, near_distance=2km, trimWindow=3yr, controlDist=10km

constraints.notes: Paper varies control sets across specifications: minimal (post, near, interaction only), with maternal demographics, with additional smoking/race indicators. Mother FE absorbs time-invariant maternal characteristics.

canonical.notes: Clustered at date level as in the paper's baseline specifications.

variants.notes: Cluster at toll plaza level (treatment group).

budgets.notes: Moderate budget reflecting the paper's own extensive robustness analysis across distance thresholds, FE structures, control sets, and subsamples.

sampling.notes: Control pool includes maternal demographics, smoking, race indicators. Stratified sampling for subset combinations.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Event study version checking for pre-trends in birth outcomes.
Placebo test using toll plazas that did not adopt E-ZPass (Table 2).
